attributes.action: Legislate that all cats be made to wear collars fitted with sonic devices to protect wildlife.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
1997, the Mammal Society carried out a survey of almost 1,000 cats. This sample killed more than 14,000 mammals, birds, reptiles and amphibians. With a population in Britain estimated as in excess of 8 million, domestic cats could be killing 275 million creatures a year.
Bell-wearing cats killed fewer mammals, though bells seem to offer little protection to birds. However, a survey carried out by the British Trust for Ornithology showed that a sonic collar which emits a regular signal, reduced the number of birds killed by 65 per cent.
